author: Prakash Kamat
text:
Goa Chief Minister Laxmikant Parsekar on Saturday denied media reports that said the government had received inputs from the Union Ministry of Home Affairs about the State being on the radar of the Islamic State.

The reports were based on information allegedly obtained from IS suspects and other terror accused. “My department did not have any inputs. There were some hints from the Home department, but such information we did not get.”

House owners alerted

The Chief Minister said the government had been asking homeowners to be vigilant about the people they let out rooms to.

“Several times despite police plea, details of new tenants are not given to the local police station in the required format by people and this creates a problem.”
title: Parsekar denies reports about Goa being on IS radar
